00129 /* Global list of principals/cache file names for machine credentials */
00130 struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *gssd_k5_kt_princ_list = NULL;
00131 
00132 /* Encryption types supported by the kernel rpcsec_gss code */
00133 int num_krb5_enctypes = 0;
00134 krb5_enctype *krb5_enctypes = NULL;
00135 
00136 /* credential expire time in advance */
00137 unsigned long machine_cred_expire_advance = 300; /* 5 mins */

00143 static int select_krb5_ccache(const struct dirent *d);
00144 static int gssd_find_existing_krb5_ccache(uid_t uid, struct dirent **d);
00145 static int gssd_get_single_krb5_cred(krb5_context context,
00146                 krb5_keytab kt, struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple);

00150 /*
00151  * convenient macros, these perhaps need further cleanup
00152  */
00153 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00154 
00155 #define KEYTAB_ENTRY_MATCH(kte, name)                                          \
00156         (                                                                      \
00157          (kte).principal->data[0].length == (sizeof(name)-1) &&                \
00158          strncmp((kte).principal->data[0].data, (name), sizeof(name)-1) == 0   \
00159         )
00160 #define KRB5_FREE_UNPARSED_NAME(ctx, name)                                     \
00161                 krb5_free_unparsed_name((ctx), (name));
00162 #define KRB5_STRDUP(str)                                                       \
00163                 strndup((str).data, (str).length)
00164 #define KRB5_STRCMP(str, name)                                                 \
00165         (                                                                      \
00166          (str)->length != strlen(name) ||                                      \
00167          strncmp((str)->data, (name), (str)->length) != 0                      \
00168         )
00169 #define KRB5_STRCASECMP(str, name)                                             \
00170         (                                                                      \
00171          (str)->length != strlen(name) ||                                      \
00172          strncasecmp((str)->data, (name), (str)->length) != 0                  \
00173         )
00174 
00175 #else /* !HAVE_KRB5 */
00176 
00177 #define KEYTAB_ENTRY_MATCH(kte, name)                                          \
00178         (                                                                      \
00179          strlen((kte).principal->name.name_string.val[0]) ==                   \
00180          (sizeof(name)-1) &&                                                   \
00181          strncmp(kte.principal->name.name_string.val[0], (name),               \
00182                  sizeof(name)-1) == 0                                          \
00183         )
00184 #define KRB5_FREE_UNPARSED_NAME(ctx, name)                                     \
00185                 free(pname);
00186 #define KRB5_STRDUP(str)                                                       \
00187                 strdup(str)
00188 #define KRB5_STRCMP(str, name)                                                 \
00189                 strcmp((str), (name))
00190 #define KRB5_STRCASECMP(str, name)                                             \
00191                 strcmp((str), (name))
00192 
00193 #endif /* HAVE_KRB5 */
00194 
00195 /*
00196  * Called from the scandir function to weed out potential krb5
00197  * credentials cache files
00198  *
00199  * Returns:
00200  *      0 => don't select this one
00201  *      1 => select this one
00202  */
00203 static int
00204 select_krb5_ccache(const struct dirent *d)
00205 {
00206         /*
00207          * Note: We used to check d->d_type for DT_REG here,
00208          * but apparenlty reiser4 always has DT_UNKNOWN.
00209          * Check for IS_REG after stat() call instead.
00210          */
00211         if (strstr(d->d_name, GSSD_DEFAULT_CRED_PREFIX))
00212                 return 1;
00213         else
00214                 return 0;
00215 }
00216 
00217 /*
00218  * Look in the ccachedir for files that look like they
00219  * are Kerberos Credential Cache files for a given UID.  Return
00220  * non-zero and the dirent pointer for the entry most likely to be
00221  * what we want. Otherwise, return zero and no dirent pointer.
00222  * The caller is responsible for freeing the dirent if one is returned.
00223  *
00224  * Returns:
00225  *      0 => could not find an existing entry
00226  *      1 => found an existing entry
00227  */
00228 static int
00229 gssd_find_existing_krb5_ccache(uid_t uid, struct dirent **d)
00230 {
00231         struct dirent **namelist;
00232         int n;
00233         int i;
00234         int found = 0;
00235         struct dirent *best_match_dir = NULL;
00236         struct stat best_match_stat, tmp_stat;
00237 
00238         memset(&best_match_stat, 0, sizeof(best_match_stat));
00239         *d = NULL;
00240         n = scandir(ccachedir, &namelist, select_krb5_ccache, 0);
00241         if (n < 0) {
00242                 perror("scandir looking for krb5 credentials caches");
00243         }
00244         else if (n > 0) {
00245                 char statname[1024];
00246                 for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00247                         printerr(3, "CC file '%s' being considered\n",
00248                                  namelist[i]->d_name);
00249                         snprintf(statname, sizeof(statname),
00250                                  "%s/%s", ccachedir, namelist[i]->d_name);
00251                         if (stat(statname, &tmp_stat)) {
00252                                 printerr(0, "Error doing stat on file '%s'\n",
00253                                          statname);
00254                                 free(namelist[i]);
00255                                 continue;
00256                         }
00257                         /* Only pick caches owned by the user (uid) */
00258                         if (tmp_stat.st_uid != uid) {
00259                                 printerr(3, "'%s' owned by %u, not %u\n",
00260                                          statname, tmp_stat.st_uid, uid);
00261                                 free(namelist[i]);
00262                                 continue;
00263                         }
00264                         if (!S_ISREG(tmp_stat.st_mode)) {
00265                                 printerr(3, "'%s' is not a regular file\n",
00266                                          statname);
00267                                 free(namelist[i]);
00268                                 continue;
00269                         }
00270                         printerr(3, "CC file '%s' matches owner check and has "
00271                                  "mtime of %u\n",
00272                                  namelist[i]->d_name, tmp_stat.st_mtime);
00273                         /*
00274                          * if more than one match is found, return the most
00275                          * recent (the one with the latest mtime), and
00276                          * don't free the dirent
00277                          */
00278                         if (!found) {
00279                                 best_match_dir = namelist[i];
00280                                 best_match_stat = tmp_stat;
00281                                 found++;
00282                         }
00283                         else {
00284                                 /*
00285                                  * If the current match has an mtime later
00286                                  * than the one we are looking at, then use
00287                                  * the current match.  Otherwise, we still
00288                                  * have the best match.
00289                                  */
00290                                 if (tmp_stat.st_mtime >
00291                                             best_match_stat.st_mtime) {
00292                                         free(best_match_dir);
00293                                         best_match_dir = namelist[i];
00294                                         best_match_stat = tmp_stat;
00295                                 }
00296                                 else {
00297                                         free(namelist[i]);
00298                                 }
00299                                 printerr(3, "CC file '%s' is our "
00300                                             "current best match "
00301                                             "with mtime of %u\n",
00302                                          best_match_dir->d_name,
00303                                          best_match_stat.st_mtime);
00304                         }
00305                 }
00306                 free(namelist);
00307         }
00308         if (found)
00309         {
00310                 *d = best_match_dir;
00311         }
00312         return found;
00313 }
00314 
00315 
00316 /*
00317  * Obtain credentials via a key in the keytab given
00318  * a keytab handle and a gssd_k5_kt_princ structure.
00319  * Checks to see if current credentials are expired,
00320  * if not, uses the keytab to obtain new credentials.
00321  *
00322  * Returns:
00323  *      0 => success (or credentials have not expired)
00324  *      nonzero => error
00325  */
00326 static int
00327 gssd_get_single_krb5_cred(krb5_context context,
00328                           krb5_keytab kt,
00329                           struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple)
00330 {
00331         krb5_get_init_creds_opt options;
00332         krb5_creds my_creds;
00333         krb5_ccache ccache = NULL;
00334         char kt_name[BUFSIZ];
00335         char cc_name[BUFSIZ];
00336         int code;
00337         time_t now = time(0);
00338         char *cache_type;
00339 
00340         memset(&my_creds, 0, sizeof(my_creds));
00341 
00342         if (ple->ccname && ple->endtime > now + machine_cred_expire_advance) {
00343                 printerr(2, "INFO: Credentials in CC '%s' are good until %d\n",
00344                          ple->ccname, ple->endtime);
00345                 code = 0;
00346                 goto out;
00347         }
00348 
00349         if ((code = krb5_kt_get_name(context, kt, kt_name, BUFSIZ))) {
00350                 printerr(0, "ERROR: Unable to get keytab name in "
00351                             "gssd_get_single_krb5_cred\n");
00352                 goto out;
00353         }
00354 
00355         krb5_get_init_creds_opt_init(&options);
00356         krb5_get_init_creds_opt_set_address_list(&options, NULL);
00357 
00358 #ifdef TEST_SHORT_LIFETIME
00359         /* set a short lifetime (for debugging only!) */
00360         printerr(0, "WARNING: Using (debug) short machine cred lifetime!\n");
00361         krb5_get_init_creds_opt_set_tkt_life(&options, 5*60);
00362 #else
00363         /* FIXME try to get the ticket with lifetime as long as possible,
00364          * to work around ticket-expiry + recovery problem in cmd3-11
00365          * remove this!!!
00366          */
00367         krb5_get_init_creds_opt_set_tkt_life(&options, 30*24*60*60);
00368 #endif
00369         if ((code = krb5_get_init_creds_keytab(context, &my_creds, ple->princ,
00370                                           kt, 0, NULL, &options))) {
00371                 char *pname;
00372                 if ((krb5_unparse_name(context, ple->princ, &pname))) {
00373                         pname = NULL;
00374                 }
00375                 printerr(0, "WARNING: %s while getting initial ticket for "
00376                             "principal '%s' from keytab '%s'\n",
00377                          error_message(code),
00378                          pname ? pname : "<unparsable>", kt_name);
00379                 if (pname) KRB5_FREE_UNPARSED_NAME(context, pname);
00380                 goto out;
00381         }
00382 
00383         /*
00384          * Initialize cache file which we're going to be using
00385          */
00386 
00387         if (use_memcache)
00388             cache_type = "MEMORY";
00389         else
00390             cache_type = "FILE";
00391         snprintf(cc_name, sizeof(cc_name), "%s:%s/%s%s_%s",
00392                 cache_type,
00393                 GSSD_DEFAULT_CRED_DIR, GSSD_DEFAULT_CRED_PREFIX,
00394                 GSSD_DEFAULT_MACHINE_CRED_SUFFIX, ple->realm);
00395         ple->endtime = my_creds.times.endtime;
00396         ple->ccname = strdup(cc_name);
00397         if (ple->ccname == NULL) {
00398                 printerr(0, "ERROR: no storage to duplicate credentials "
00399                             "cache name\n");
00400                 code = ENOMEM;
00401                 goto out;
00402         }
00403         if ((code = krb5_cc_resolve(context, cc_name, &ccache))) {
00404                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s while opening credential cache '%s'\n",
00405                          error_message(code), cc_name);
00406                 goto out;
00407         }
00408         if ((code = krb5_cc_initialize(context, ccache, ple->princ))) {
00409                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s while initializing credential "
00410                          "cache '%s'\n", error_message(code), cc_name);
00411                 goto out;
00412         }
00413         if ((code = krb5_cc_store_cred(context, ccache, &my_creds))) {
00414                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s while storing credentials in '%s'\n",
00415                          error_message(code), cc_name);
00416                 goto out;
00417         }
00418 
00419         code = 0;
00420         printerr(1, "Using (machine) credentials cache: '%s'\n", cc_name);
00421   out:
00422         if (ccache)
00423                 krb5_cc_close(context, ccache);
00424         krb5_free_cred_contents(context, &my_creds);
00425         return (code);
00426 }
00427 
00428 static struct gssd_k5_kt_princ * gssd_get_realm_ple(void *r)
00429 {
00430         struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple;
00431 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00432         krb5_data *realm = (krb5_data *)r;
00433 #else
00434         char *realm = (char *)r;
00435 #endif
00436 
00437         for (ple = gssd_k5_kt_princ_list; ple; ple = ple->next) {
00438                 if (KRB5_STRCMP(realm, ple->realm) == 0)
00439                     return ple;
00440         }
00441         return NULL;
00442 }
00443 
00444 static void gssd_free_ple(krb5_context kctx, struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple)
00445 {
00446         if (ple->princ)
00447                 krb5_free_principal(kctx, ple->princ);
00448         if (ple->realm)
00449                 free(ple->realm);
00450         if (ple->ccname)
00451                 free(ple->ccname);
00452         free(ple);
00453 }
00454 
00455 static int gssd_remove_ple(krb5_context kctx, struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple)
00456 {
00457         struct gssd_k5_kt_princ **prev = &gssd_k5_kt_princ_list;
00458         struct gssd_k5_kt_princ  *ent = gssd_k5_kt_princ_list;
00459 
00460         for (; ent; prev = &ent->next, ent = ent->next) {
00461                 if (ent != ple)
00462                         continue;
00463 
00464                 *prev = ent->next;
00465                 gssd_free_ple(kctx, ent);
00466                 return 1;
00467         }
00468         return 0;
00469 }
00470 
00471 static
00472 struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *gssd_create_ple(krb5_context kctx,
00473                                          krb5_principal principal)
00474 {
00475         struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple;
00476         krb5_error_code          code;
00477 
00478         ple = malloc(sizeof(*ple));
00479         if (ple == NULL) {
00480                 printerr(0, "ERROR: could not allocate storage "
00481                             "for principal list entry\n");
00482                 return NULL;
00483         }
00484 
00485         memset(ple, 0, sizeof(*ple));
00486 
00487         ple->realm = KRB5_STRDUP(principal->realm);
00488         if (ple->realm == NULL) {
00489                 printerr(0, "ERROR: not enough memory while copying realm to "
00490                             "principal list entry\n");
00491                 goto err_free;
00492         }
00493 
00494         code = krb5_copy_principal(kctx, principal, &ple->princ);
00495         if (code) {
00496                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s while copying principal "
00497                             "to principal list entry\n",
00498                          error_message(code));
00499                 goto err_free;
00500         }
00501 
00502         return ple;
00503 err_free:
00504         gssd_free_ple(kctx, ple);
00505         return NULL;
00506 }
00507 
00508 /*
00509  * Process the given keytab file and create a list of principals we
00510  * might use to perform mount operations.
00511  *
00512  * Returns:
00513  *      0 => Success
00514  *      nonzero => Error
00515  */
00516 static int
00517 gssd_process_krb5_keytab(krb5_context context, krb5_keytab kt, char *kt_name)
00518 {
00519         krb5_kt_cursor cursor;
00520         krb5_keytab_entry kte;
00521         krb5_error_code code;
00522         struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple;
00523         int retval = -1;
00524 
00525         /*
00526          * Look through each entry in the keytab file and determine
00527          * if we might want to use it later to do a mount.  If so,
00528          * save info in the global principal list
00529          * (gssd_k5_kt_princ_list).
00530          * Note: (ple == principal list entry)
00531          */
00532         if ((code = krb5_kt_start_seq_get(context, kt, &cursor))) {
00533                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s while beginning keytab scan "
00534                             "for keytab '%s'\n",
00535                         error_message(code), kt_name);
00536                 retval = code;
00537                 goto out;
00538         }
00539 
00540         while ((code = krb5_kt_next_entry(context, kt, &kte, &cursor)) == 0) {
00541                 char *pname;
00542                 if ((code = krb5_unparse_name(context, kte.principal,
00543                                               &pname))) {
00544                         printerr(0, "WARNING: Skipping keytab entry because "
00545                                     "we failed to unparse principal name: %s\n",
00546                                  error_message(code));
00547                         continue;
00548                 }
00549                 printerr(2, "Processing keytab entry for principal '%s'\n",
00550                          pname);
00551 
00552                 /* mds service entry:
00553                  *   - hostname and realm should match this node
00554                  *   - replace existing non-mds entry of this realm
00555                  */
00556                 if (KEYTAB_ENTRY_MATCH(kte, GSSD_SERVICE_MDS)) {
00557                         krb5_principal princ = kte.principal;
00558                         krb5_data *princ_host;
00559                         struct utsname utsbuf;
00560                         struct hostent *host;
00561 
00562                         if (KRB5_STRCASECMP(krb5_princ_realm(context, princ),
00563                                             this_realm) != 0) {
00564                                 printerr(2, "alien mds service entry, skip\n");
00565                                 goto next;
00566                         }
00567 
00568                         princ_host = krb5_princ_component(context, princ, 1);
00569                         if (princ_host == NULL) {
00570                                 printerr(2, "mds service entry: no hostname in "
00571                                          "principal, skip\n");
00572                                 goto next;
00573                         }
00574 
00575                         if (uname(&utsbuf)) {
00576                                 printerr(2, "mds service entry: unable to get "
00577                                          "UTS name, skip\n");
00578                                 goto next;
00579                         }
00580                         host = gethostbyname(utsbuf.nodename);
00581                         if (host == NULL) {
00582                                 printerr(2, "mds service entry: unable to get "
00583                                          "local hostname, skip\n");
00584                                 goto next;
00585                         }
00586 
00587                         if (KRB5_STRCASECMP(princ_host, host->h_name) != 0) {
00588                                 printerr(2, "mds service entry: hostname "
00589                                          "doesn't match: %s - %.*s, skip\n",
00590                                          host->h_name,
00591                                          princ_host->length, princ_host->data);
00592                                 goto next;
00593                         }
00594 
00595                         ple = gssd_get_realm_ple((void *)&kte.principal->realm);
00596                         if (ple) {
00597                                 if (ple->fl_mds) {
00598                                         printerr(2,"mds service entry: found a"
00599                                                  "duplicated one, it's like a "
00600                                                  "mis-configuration, skip\n");
00601                                         goto next;
00602                                 }
00603 
00604                                 gssd_remove_ple(context, ple);
00605                                 printerr(2, "mds service entry: replace an "
00606                                          "existed non-mds one\n");
00607                         }
00608                 } else if (KEYTAB_ENTRY_MATCH(kte, LUSTRE_ROOT_NAME)) {
00609                         ple = gssd_get_realm_ple((void *)&kte.principal->realm);
00610                         if (ple) {
00611                                 if (ple->fl_mds || ple->fl_root) {
00612                                         printerr(2, "root entry: found a "
00613                                                  "existed %s entry, skip\n",
00614                                                  ple->fl_mds ? "mds" : "root");
00615                                         goto next;
00616                                 }
00617 
00618                                 gssd_remove_ple(context, ple);
00619                                 printerr(2, "root entry: replace an existed "
00620                                          "non-mds non-root one\n");
00621                         }
00622                 } else {
00623                         printerr(2, "We will NOT use this entry (%s)\n",
00624                                 pname);
00625                         goto next;
00626                 }
00627 
00628                 /* construct ple */
00629                 printerr(2, "We will use this entry (%s)\n", pname);
00630                 ple = gssd_create_ple(context, kte.principal);
00631                 if (ple == NULL) {
00632                         KRB5_FREE_UNPARSED_NAME(context, pname);
00633                         goto out;
00634                 }
00635 
00636                 /* add proper flags */
00637                 if (KEYTAB_ENTRY_MATCH(kte, GSSD_SERVICE_MDS))
00638                         ple->fl_mds = 1;
00639                 else if (KEYTAB_ENTRY_MATCH(kte, LUSTRE_ROOT_NAME))
00640                         ple->fl_root = 1;
00641 
00642                 /* enqueue */
00643                 if (gssd_k5_kt_princ_list == NULL)
00644                         gssd_k5_kt_princ_list = ple;
00645                 else {
00646                         ple->next = gssd_k5_kt_princ_list;
00647                         gssd_k5_kt_princ_list = ple;
00648                 }
00649  next:
00650                 KRB5_FREE_UNPARSED_NAME(context, pname);
00651         }
00652 
00653         if ((code = krb5_kt_end_seq_get(context, kt, &cursor))) {
00654                 printerr(0, "WARNING: %s while ending keytab scan for "
00655                             "keytab '%s'\n",
00656                          error_message(code), kt_name);
00657         }
00658 
00659         retval = 0;
00660   out:
00661         return retval;
00662 }
00663 
00664 /*
00665  * Depending on the version of Kerberos, we either need to use
00666  * a private function, or simply set the environment variable.
00667  */
00668 static void
00669 gssd_set_krb5_ccache_name(char *ccname)
00670 {
00671 #ifdef USE_GSS_KRB5_CCACHE_NAME
00672         unsigned int    maj_stat, min_stat;
00673 
00674         printerr(2, "using gss_krb5_ccache_name to select krb5 ccache %s\n",
00675                  ccname);
00676         maj_stat = gss_krb5_ccache_name(&min_stat, ccname, NULL);
00677         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00678                 printerr(0, "WARNING: gss_krb5_ccache_name with "
00679                         "name '%s' failed (%s)\n",
00680                         ccname, error_message(min_stat));
00681         }
00682 #else
00683         /*
00684          * Set the KRB5CCNAME environment variable to tell the krb5 code
00685          * which credentials cache to use.  (Instead of using the private
00686          * function above for which there is no generic gssapi
00687          * equivalent.)
00688          */
00689         printerr(2, "using environment variable to select krb5 ccache %s\n",
00690                  ccname);
00691         setenv("KRB5CCNAME", ccname, 1);
00692 #endif
00693 }
00694 
00695 /*
00696  * Parse the supported encryption type information
00697  */
00698 static int
00699 parse_enctypes(char *enctypes)
00700 {
00701         int n = 0;
00702         char *curr, *comma;
00703         int i;
00704 
00705         /* Just in case this ever gets called more than once */
00706         if (krb5_enctypes != NULL) {
00707                 free(krb5_enctypes);
00708                 krb5_enctypes = NULL;
00709                 num_krb5_enctypes = 0;
00710         }
00711 
00712         /* count the number of commas */
00713         for (curr = enctypes; curr && *curr != '\0'; curr = ++comma) {
00714                 comma = strchr(curr, ',');
00715                 if (comma != NULL)
00716                         n++;
00717                 else
00718                         break;
00719         }
00720         /* If no more commas and we're not at the end, there's one more value */
00721         if (*curr != '\0')
00722                 n++;
00723 
00724         /* Empty string, return an error */
00725         if (n == 0)
00726                 return ENOENT;
00727 
00728         /* Allocate space for enctypes array */
00729         if ((krb5_enctypes = (int *) calloc(n, sizeof(int))) == NULL) {
00730                 return ENOMEM;
00731         }
00732 
00733         /* Now parse each value into the array */
00734         for (curr = enctypes, i = 0; curr && *curr != '\0'; curr = ++comma) {
00735                 krb5_enctypes[i++] = atoi(curr);
00736                 comma = strchr(curr, ',');
00737                 if (comma == NULL)
00738                         break;
00739         }
00740 
00741         num_krb5_enctypes = n;
00742         return 0;
00743 }
00744 
00745 /*==========================*/
00746 /*===  External routines ===*/
00747 /*==========================*/
00748 
00749 /*
00750  * Attempt to find the best match for a credentials cache file
00751  * given only a UID.  We really need more information, but we
00752  * do the best we can.
00753  *
00754  * Returns:
00755  *      void
00756  */
00757 void
00758 gssd_setup_krb5_user_gss_ccache(uid_t uid, char *servername)
00759 {
00760         char                    buf[MAX_NETOBJ_SZ];
00761         struct dirent           *d;
00762 
00763         printerr(2, "getting credentials for client with uid %u for "
00764                     "server %s\n", uid, servername);
00765         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
00766 
00767         if (gssd_find_existing_krb5_ccache(uid, &d)) {
00768                 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "FILE:%s/%s",
00769                         ccachedir, d->d_name);
00770                 free(d);
00771         }
00772         else
00773                 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "FILE:%s/%s%u",
00774                         ccachedir, GSSD_DEFAULT_CRED_PREFIX, uid);
00775         printerr(2, "using %s as credentials cache for client with "
00776                     "uid %u for server %s\n", buf, uid, servername);
00777         gssd_set_krb5_ccache_name(buf);
00778 }
00779 
00780 /*
00781  * Let the gss code know where to find the machine credentials ccache.
00782  *
00783  * Returns:
00784  *      void
00785  */
00786 void
00787 gssd_setup_krb5_machine_gss_ccache(char *ccname)
00788 {
00789         printerr(2, "using %s as credentials cache for machine creds\n",
00790                  ccname);
00791         gssd_set_krb5_ccache_name(ccname);
00792 }
00793 
00794 /*
00795  * The first time through this routine, go through the keytab and
00796  * determine which keys we will try to use as machine credentials.
00797  * Every time through this routine, try to obtain credentials using
00798  * the keytab entries selected the first time through.
00799  *
00800  * Returns:
00801  *      0 => obtained one or more credentials
00802  *      nonzero => error
00803  *
00804  */
00805 
00806 int
00807 gssd_refresh_krb5_machine_creds(void)
00808 {
00809         krb5_context context = NULL;
00810         krb5_keytab kt = NULL;;
00811         krb5_error_code code;
00812         int retval = -1;
00813         struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple;
00814         int gotone = 0;
00815         static int processed_keytab = 0;
00816 
00817 
00818         code = krb5_init_context(&context);
00819         if (code) {
00820                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s while initializing krb5 in "
00821                             "gssd_refresh_krb5_machine_creds\n",
00822                          error_message(code));
00823                 retval = code;
00824                 goto out;
00825         }
00826 
00827         printerr(2, "Using keytab file '%s'\n", keytabfile);
00828 
00829         if ((code = krb5_kt_resolve(context, keytabfile, &kt))) {
00830                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s while resolving keytab '%s'\n",
00831                          error_message(code), keytabfile);
00832                 goto out;
00833         }
00834 
00835         /* Only go through the keytab file once.  Only print messages once. */
00836         if (gssd_k5_kt_princ_list == NULL && !processed_keytab) {
00837                 processed_keytab = 1;
00838                 gssd_process_krb5_keytab(context, kt, keytabfile);
00839                 if (gssd_k5_kt_princ_list == NULL) {
00840                         printerr(0, "ERROR: No usable keytab entries found in "
00841                                     "keytab '%s'\n", keytabfile);
00842                         printerr(0, "You must have a valid keytab entry for "
00843                                     "%s/<your.host>@<YOUR.REALM> on MDT nodes, "
00844                                     "and %s@<YOUR.REALM> on client nodes, in "
00845                                     "keytab file %s ?\n",
00846                                     GSSD_SERVICE_MDS, LUSTRE_ROOT_NAME,
00847                                     keytabfile);
00848                 }
00849         }
00850 
00851         /*
00852          * If we don't have any keytab entries we liked, then we have a problem
00853          */
00854         if (gssd_k5_kt_princ_list == NULL) {
00855                 retval = ENOENT;
00856                 goto out;
00857         }
00858 
00859         /*
00860          * Now go through the list of saved entries and get initial
00861          * credentials for them (We can't do this while making the
00862          * list because it messes up the keytab iteration cursor
00863          * when we use the keytab to get credentials.)
00864          */
00865         for (ple = gssd_k5_kt_princ_list; ple; ple = ple->next) {
00866                 if ((gssd_get_single_krb5_cred(context, kt, ple)) == 0) {
00867                         gotone++;
00868                 }
00869         }
00870         if (!gotone) {
00871                 printerr(0, "ERROR: No usable machine credentials obtained\n");
00872                 goto out;
00873         }
00874 
00875         retval = 0;
00876   out:
00877         if (kt) krb5_kt_close(context, kt);
00878         krb5_free_context(context);
00879 
00880         return retval;
00881 }
00882 
00883 
00884 /*
00885  * Return an array of pointers to names of credential cache files
00886  * which can be used to try to create gss contexts with a server.
00887  *
00888  * Returns:
00889  *      0 => list is attached
00890  *      nonzero => error
00891  */
00892 int
00893 gssd_get_krb5_machine_cred_list(char ***list)
00894 {
00895         char **l;
00896         int listinc = 10;
00897         int listsize = listinc;
00898         int i = 0;
00899         int retval;
00900         struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple;
00901 
00902         /* Assume failure */
00903         *list = NULL;
00904 
00905         /* Refresh machine credentials */
00906         retval = gssd_refresh_krb5_machine_creds();
00907         if (retval)
00908                 goto out;
00909 
00910         l = malloc(listsize * sizeof(char *));
00911         if (l == NULL) {
00912                 retval = ENOMEM;
00913                 goto out;
00914         }
00915 
00916         for (ple = gssd_k5_kt_princ_list; ple; ple = ple->next) {
00917                 if (ple->ccname) {
00918                         if (i + 1 > listsize) {
00919                                 void *tmp;
00920 
00921                                 listsize += listinc;
00922                                 tmp = realloc(l, listsize * sizeof(char *));
00923                                 if (tmp == NULL) {
00924                                         retval = ENOMEM;
00925                                         goto out_free;
00926                                 }
00927                                 l = tmp;
00928                         }
00929                         l[i] = strdup(ple->ccname);
00930                         if (l[i++] == NULL) {
00931                                 retval = ENOMEM;
00932                                 goto out_free;
00933                         }
00934                 }
00935         }
00936         if (i > 0) {
00937                 l[i] = NULL;
00938                 *list = l;
00939                 return 0;
00940         }
00941 out_free:
00942         while (i > 0)
00943                 free(l[i--]);
00944         free(l);
00945 out:
00946         return retval;
00947 }
00948 
00949 /*
00950  * Frees the list of names returned in get_krb5_machine_cred_list()
00951  */
00952 void
00953 gssd_free_krb5_machine_cred_list(char **list)
00954 {
00955         char **n;
00956 
00957         if (list == NULL)
00958                 return;
00959         for (n = list; n && *n; n++) {
00960                 free(*n);
00961         }
00962         free(list);
00963 }
00964 
00965 /*
00966  * Called upon exit.  Destroys machine credentials.
00967  */
00968 void
00969 gssd_destroy_krb5_machine_creds(void)
00970 {
00971         krb5_context context;
00972         krb5_error_code code = 0;
00973         krb5_ccache ccache;
00974         struct gssd_k5_kt_princ *ple;
00975 
00976         code = krb5_init_context(&context);
00977         if (code) {
00978                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s while initializing krb5\n",
00979                          error_message(code));
00980                 goto out;
00981         }
00982 
00983         for (ple = gssd_k5_kt_princ_list; ple; ple = ple->next) {
00984                 if (!ple->ccname)
00985                         continue;
00986                 if ((code = krb5_cc_resolve(context, ple->ccname, &ccache))) {
00987                         printerr(0, "WARNING: %s while resolving credential "
00988                                     "cache '%s' for destruction\n",
00989                                  error_message(code), ple->ccname);
00990                         continue;
00991                 }
00992 
00993                 if ((code = krb5_cc_destroy(context, ccache))) {
00994                         printerr(0, "WARNING: %s while destroying credential "
00995                                     "cache '%s'\n",
00996                                  error_message(code), ple->ccname);
00997                 }
00998         }
00999   out:
01000         krb5_free_context(context);
01001 }
01002 
01003 #if 0
01004 #ifdef HAVE_SET_ALLOWABLE_ENCTYPES
01005 /*
01006  * this routine obtains a credentials handle via gss_acquire_cred()
01007  * then calls gss_krb5_set_allowable_enctypes() to limit the encryption
01008  * types negotiated.
01009  *
01010  * Returns:
01011  *      0 => all went well
01012  *     -1 => there was an error
01013  */
01014 
01015 int
01016 limit_krb5_enctypes(struct rpc_gss_sec *sec, uid_t uid)
01017 {
01018         unsigned int maj_stat, min_stat;
01019         gss_cred_id_t credh;
01020         gss_OID_set_desc  desired_mechs;
01021         krb5_enctype enctypes[] = {ENCTYPE_DES_CBC_CRC};
01022         int num_enctypes = sizeof(enctypes) / sizeof(enctypes[0]);
01023 
01024         /* We only care about getting a krb5 cred */
01025         desired_mechs.count = 1;
01026         desired_mechs.elements = &krb5oid;
01027 
01028         maj_stat = gss_acquire_cred(&min_stat, NULL, 0,
01029                                     &desired_mechs, GSS_C_INITIATE,
01030                                     &credh, NULL, NULL);
01031 
01032         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
01033                 pgsserr("gss_acquire_cred",
01034                         maj_stat, min_stat, &krb5oid);
01035                 return -1;
01036         }
01037 
01038         /*
01039          * If we failed for any reason to produce global
01040          * list of supported enctypes, use local default here.
01041          */
01042         if (krb5_enctypes == NULL)
01043                 maj_stat = gss_set_allowable_enctypes(&min_stat, credh,
01044                                         &krb5oid, num_enctypes, &enctypes);
01045         else
01046                 maj_stat = gss_set_allowable_enctypes(&min_stat, credh,
01047                                         &krb5oid, num_krb5_enctypes,
01048                                         krb5_enctypes);
01049         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
01050                 pgsserr("gss_set_allowable_enctypes",
01051                         maj_stat, min_stat, &krb5oid);
01052                 return -1;
01053         }
01054         sec->cred = credh;
01055 
01056         return 0;
01057 }
01058 #endif  /* HAVE_SET_ALLOWABLE_ENCTYPES */
01059 #endif
01060 
01061 #if 0
01062 /*
01063  * Obtain supported enctypes from kernel.
01064  * Set defaults if info is not available.
01065  */
01066 void
01067 gssd_obtain_kernel_krb5_info(void)
01068 {
01069         char enctype_file_name[128];
01070         char buf[1024];
01071         char enctypes[128];
01072         int nscanned;
01073         int fd;
01074         int use_default_enctypes = 0;
01075         int nbytes, numfields;
01076         char default_enctypes[] = "1,3,2";
01077         int code;
01078 
01079         snprintf(enctype_file_name, sizeof(enctype_file_name),
01080                  "%s/%s", pipefs_dir, "krb5_info");
01081 
01082         if ((fd = open(enctype_file_name, O_RDONLY)) == -1) {
01083                 printerr(1, "WARNING: gssd_obtain_kernel_krb5_info: "
01084                          "Unable to open '%s'. Unable to determine "
01085                          "Kerberos encryption types supported by the "
01086                          "kernel; using defaults (%s).\n",
01087                          enctype_file_name, default_enctypes);
01088                 use_default_enctypes = 1;
01089                 goto do_the_parse;
01090         }
01091         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
01092         if ((nbytes = read(fd, buf, sizeof(buf)-1)) == -1) {
01093                 printerr(0, "WARNING: gssd_obtain_kernel_krb5_info: "
01094                          "Error reading Kerberos encryption type "
01095                          "information file '%s'; using defaults (%s).\n",
01096                          enctype_file_name, default_enctypes);
01097                 use_default_enctypes = 1;
01098                 close(fd);
01099                 goto do_the_parse;
01100         }
01101         close(fd);
01102         numfields = sscanf(buf, "enctypes: %s\n%n", enctypes, &nscanned);
01103         if (numfields < 1) {
01104                 printerr(0, "WARNING: gssd_obtain_kernel_krb5_info: "
01105                          "error parsing Kerberos encryption type "
01106                          "information from file '%s'; using defaults (%s).\n",
01107                          enctype_file_name, default_enctypes);
01108                 use_default_enctypes = 1;
01109                 goto do_the_parse;
01110         }
01111         if (nbytes > nscanned) {
01112                 printerr(2, "gssd_obtain_kernel_krb5_info: "
01113                          "Ignoring extra information, '%s', from '%s'\n",
01114                          buf+nscanned, enctype_file_name);
01115                 goto do_the_parse;
01116         }
01117   do_the_parse:
01118         if (use_default_enctypes)
01119                 strcpy(enctypes, default_enctypes);
01120 
01121         if ((code = parse_enctypes(enctypes)) != 0) {
01122                 printerr(0, "ERROR: gssd_obtain_kernel_krb5_info: "
01123                          "parse_enctypes%s failed with code %d\n",
01124                          use_default_enctypes ? " (with default enctypes)" : "",
01125                          code);
01126         }
01127 }
01128 #endif
